com.camerontec.catalys.util.data

Interface IBindable<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the object to be bound.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IFastEncodableMessage, IFIXMessage, IMarketInfo, ITagValueIteratorBindable<I>, ITagValues, ITagValuesReadable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDepthFullUpdateMessage, AbstractMarketDataMessage, AbstractTagValues, AbstractTagValuesReadable, CSMAMessage, CSMDMessage, CSMHMessage, DepthDecoratorBase, DepthEntryIncrementalDecorator, DepthFullUpdateDecorator, DepthFullUpdateIncrementalDecorator, DepthFullUpdateSnapshotDecorator, ECNIMessage, ECNPMessage, EMXMessage, FIXMessageAsArray, FIXMessageAsIndexedByteArray, FIXMessageAsIndexedList, FIXMessageAsList, FIXMessageDecoratorBase, FIXMessageWithPluggableStore, MACKMessage, MarketDataDecoratorBase, MERRMessage, MirrorTagValues, OINPMessage, OrderedFIXMessage, OrderedTagValues, RepeatingGroupEntry, ReusableDepthEntryUpdateMessage, ReusableDepthFullUpdateMessage, ReusableDepthSnapshotMessage, ReusableMarketDataIncrementalRefresh, ReusableMarketDataTopOfBookSnapshot, ReusableMarketDataTopOfBookUpdate, ReusableMessage, RuleTrackingFIXMessage, SampleFastCompatibleMessage, SampleFIXMessage, ScpOutboundMessage, SetValueStoreMessage, TagValuesAsArray, TagValuesAsIndexedByteArray, TagValuesAsIndexedList, TagValuesAsList, TagValuesAsOrderedIndexedList, TBKDMessage, TopOfBookIncrementalDecorator, TopOfBookSnapshotDecorator, TREQMessage, TRESMessage, VREQMessage, VRESMessage

    public interface IBindable<T>
    Interface defining a general contract for binding an instance of an object to another object.

    This interface does not attempt to define what binding means, rather that is left to implementation. This interface merely provides for the ability to test for bindability and then the ability to create the binding.

    There is no facility for explicitly breaking bindings. If required, it is expected that the bound object can do that itself. This implies the following:

    • The instance to which the object is bound does not maintain a reference to the bound object
    • The bound object can be simultaneously bound to at most one other object
    • Binding an object to another instance implies the binding to the original object is broken.

    Objects should be tested for bindability via isBindable(Object) prior to being bound. If an attempt is made to bind an object of an unsuitable type, or one which is in an unsuitable state, an exception is thrown.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T bind(T object)
      Create a binding between the specified object and this instance.
      boolean isBindable(T object)
      Return whether the specified object is bindable to this object.

    • Method Detail

      • isBindable

        boolean isBindable(T object)
        Return whether the specified object is bindable to this object.
        Parameters:
        object - The object being tested for its bindability.
        Returns:
        True if the object is bindable, false otherwise.

      • bind

        T bind(T object)
        Create a binding between the specified object and this instance.

        It is recommended that the object be tested for bindability first, via isBindable(Object), before attempting to create a binding. This method must guarantee to succeed provided isBindable(Object) returns true in a happens before context.

        Parameters:
        object - The object to be bound. Whether the implementation supports the binding of null objects, for example via autovivification, is implementation dependent. If binding of a null object is supported then this should be reflected via the isBindable(Object) method.
        Returns:
        The object after it has been successfully bound.
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - On attempting to bind an object of incompatible type to this instance.
